alert.note: Alert for Esmeralda and Central Nye County; Lincoln County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 17 at 12:41PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: .A substantial moisture surge driven by Hurricane Hilary will result in several days of moderately heavy rainfall over the weekend into early next week. Impacts will become more significant with each passing day as soils saturate, resulting in increased runoff. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of southeast California and south central Nevada, including the following areas, in southeast California, Death Valley National Park, Eastern Sierra Slopes, Owens Valley and White Mountains of Inyo County. In south central Nevada, Esmeralda and Central Nye County and Lincoln County. * WHEN...From Saturday evening through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Esmeralda and Central Nye County; Lincoln County
